stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream blocking-out and brainstorming the Raphael-the-Raven boss for Course 13 (an ice castle).  He imports the course’s music, tweaks textures for a tower and nest set-piece, and talks through mechanical, technical and aesthetic requirements for the fight.

development_findings.summary: Overall game progress: 120 stars finished, on Course 13 out of 15, overworld underway and ~30 % of enemies implemented.
development_findings.quote: We are currently like 120 stars done and we're working on the overworld and the enemies, so it's getting pretty close. We have probably around 30 % of the enemies in now.

development_findings.summary: Planned total collectables: about 180 stars plus 75 Yoshi-coin equivalents (five per level).
development_findings.quote: There would be 75 of those [Yoshi coins] ... and then I think 180 stars on top of that.

development_findings.summary: Music scope: 98 custom tracks so far, surpassing Mario Odyssey’s 82.  ~80-90 % are M64 (MIDI-style) converted with SaC64; ~20 % are streamed due to cartridge size limits.
development_findings.quote: Right now we have, I think, 98 songs in the game. … About 80-90 % of the OST is done via a MIDI-like format called M64 … and the other 20 % is streamed music but it's very big, so we can't use it too much.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 fog bug: when material bleeding is enabled, fog remains on even when disabled, making Course 12 look wrong on real N64 hardware.
development_findings.quote: There's a Fast64 bug that makes Geomode's fog always on … That's why my Course 12 looks so bugged on N64.

development_findings.summary: Camera design: refuses to add true second-stick analog camera because N64 has only one stick; D-pad can already move camera slowly.
development_findings.quote: How am I supposed to add analog camera … considering we only have one analog stick? … You can use the D-pad to move slowly if you want.

development_findings.summary: Raphael-the-Raven fight concept: begins on an icy tower with a nest, Raven eclipses the moon, flips gravity so Mario falls upward, lands on a low-gravity ‘frozen cheese’ moon, dodges shooting-star projectiles, grabs thawed cheese stars, and throws them to damage Raven; after each hit Mario is flung back through the star-field.  Fight ends with a star emerging from a Yoshi egg in the nest.
Technical challenge: needs localised planetary gravity around the moon but wants it confined to the boss actor rather than global physics; plans to ask contributor Arthur for code.
development_findings.quote: Programming the moon is going to be awful. … I'm going to ask Arthur for his planetary gravity code because he already knows what to do.

development_findings.summary: Memory/format constraint leads to two-cycle combined combiner tricks and texture-layer approaches (e.g., snow-covered bricks, transparent nests) instead of higher-poly models.
No release date; game will not be released ‘early access’—Kaze insists on shipping only when finished to avoid an EA-style backlash.
development_findings.quote: I can't release it before it's finished, unfortunately, because then I would release an unfinished product, the thing that everybody hates EA for.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: Mario 64 is about freedom and self-directed challenge; forcing linear difficulty or checkpoints would ‘ruin a lot of it’.
context_findings.quote: Mario 64 is about freedom and exploration … If you want the game to be more difficult then do more risky jumps.

context_findings.summary: Reaction to audience doubt: viewers assumed early versions of levels ‘looked like ass’; Kaze reminds them his levels always polish up later.
context_findings.quote: Everyone thought that level is going to be complete ass … Surely you know that the levels always look like shit at the beginning and then look better at the end.

context_findings.summary: Personal life: recently had a baby with Zeina; jokes about not being able to lactate; juggling development with parenting and weight-lifting (knee injury limits squats).
context_findings.quote: I guess I can't feed the baby, I do not have boobs. … I had a pretty terrible knee injury recently so my squats … I'm being careful about.

context_findings.summary: Worldview on careers: criticises people who choose programming solely for high salaries, predicting the ‘bubble’ would burst.
context_findings.quote: All I want is money … That's how people treated programming for the longest time and of course the bubble was going to burst.

biobak.summary: Supplied a reference video for the Raphael-the-Raven fight that sparked Kaze’s current design work.

badub.summary: Composed multiple highlighted tracks (Ice Castle, Oily Boily Bay, Bowser’s Office & elevator); praised for creativity.
badub.quote: Badubb's music is great. The creativity he brings to the table is very, very sick.

zeina.summary: Handling more childcare than Kaze during development; workload acknowledged on stream.
zeina.quote: Of course, Zeina has a lot more work with it than I do.

key_stories.title: Re-imagining Raphael the Raven
key_stories.summary: Kaze needs to translate Yoshi’s Island’s 2D moon fight into a 3D Mario 64 hack.  He brainstorms visual spectacle, mechanical depth, and technical feasibility live on stream.
key_stories.challenge: Adapting a beloved 2D boss to 3D while keeping it fresh and respectful.
key_stories.process: Discussed multiple concepts (inside/outside moon, hollow moon, ice variant, gravity flip), evaluated engine limits, settled on an ‘ice cheese’ moon with local gravity managed by actor code.
key_stories.outcome: Sketched full three-phase design with intro cut-scene, low-gravity arena, shooting-star projectiles, and Yoshi-egg reward.
key_stories.key_quote: My vision is he's here, the big ice moon in the background … you slowly see the moon darken, his eyes pop up, then he stomps and Mario falls into the stars.

key_stories.title: The Fast64 Fog Bug
key_stories.summary: A bug in Fast64 causes fog to remain enabled when material bleeding is used, breaking visuals on Course 12.
key_stories.challenge: Inconsistent fog state between Blender preview and N64 hardware.
key_stories.process: Diagnosed the issue with chat, confirmed it’s a Fast64 material-bleeding bug.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze plans to adjust assets or wait for a Fast64 fix to restore proper visuals.
key_stories.key_quote: There's a Fast64 bug that makes Geomode's fog always on, even though it shouldn't be.

key_stories.title: Importing the Ice Castle Theme
key_stories.summary: Kaze demonstrates how custom streamed tracks are prepared and looped for N64.
key_stories.challenge: Finding precise loop points and fitting stereo audio into engine constraints.
key_stories.process: Listened to track, located beat alignment, calculated sample offsets, split into L/R channels, replaced placeholder stream in build.
key_stories.outcome: Ice Castle music now plays and loops correctly in-game.
key_stories.key_quote: I'm no good with music, guys … 0866 to 93633 and that's the loop.
